intro: Braya thorild-wulffii, commonly known as the Thorild-Wulff's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many species with small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are usually basal, arranged in a rosette, and its flowers are white or pale pink, often appearing in clusters. Braya thorild-wulffii is a perennial species that thrives in alpine and subalpine habitats.
